column2: Aster Medcity is looking for Staff Nurse Nursing Services to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As a Staff Nurse, your role is to provide direct patient care, assist physicians and other healthcare professionals, and ensure the overall well-being of patients      You work in various healthcare settings, such as hospitals, clinics, nursing homes, and community health centers        Here are some key responsibilities and tasks associated with this role:        Patient Care: Provide direct nursing care to patients, including monitoring vital signs, administering medications, performing medical procedures (such as wound care or IV therapy), and assisting with activities of daily living (ADLs) as needed      Patient Assessment: Assess patients' physical and mental health status, document their medical history, and conduct regular patient evaluations to monitor changes in condition or response to treatment      Recognize and report any abnormal findings or symptoms to the appropriate healthcare providers      Care Planning and Implementation: Develop and implement individualized care plans in collaboration with the healthcare team      Ensure that patient care is delivered according to established protocols, standards, and evidence-based practices      Patient Education: Educate patients and their families about their medical conditions, treatment plans, medication administration, and self-care techniques      Provide instructions on lifestyle modifications, disease prevention, and health promotion      Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with physicians, registered nurses, and other healthcare professionals to coordinate patient care      Communicate effectively and exchange pertinent information regarding patient status, treatment plans, and care transitions
column11: Nursing, Staff Nurse

column2: An ER Nurse, or Emergency Nurse, is in charge of providing healthcare to patients who urgently need treatment so that they can stabilize their vital signs and limit pain and discomfort.      Their duties include identifying the needs of a patient, filling out charts and intake paper and collecting information and samples quickly to run necessary tests.          An ER Nurse duties and responsibilities are focused on giving timely care to their patients and in a fast-paced environment.            ER Nurse have the responsibilities of:            Triage incoming patients based on level of injury or illness.      Immediately stabilize incoming patients.      Administer medication as instructed by physicians.      Start intravenous lines, and assist on broken bones.      Perform tracheotomies and intubations.      Give patients stitches and sutures.      Create and maintain incoming patient records.      Work with team of emergency staff to help patients.      Help transfer stable patients to necessary Wings as advised by Consultants.
column11: Nursing, Incharge, Networking, Emergency Nurse, Focus, Banking, Healthcare, NABL, NABH, Nurse

column2: Aster Medcity is looking for Technician Operation Theatre to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     A Technician in the Operation Theatre, also known as an Operating Room (OR) Technician or Surgical Technician, is a healthcare professional who plays a crucial role in assisting surgeons and other surgical team members during surgical procedures     Their responsibilities include preparing the operating room, ensuring the availability of necessary instruments and equipment, and providing support during surgeries       Here are the key responsibilities and skills associated with this role:     Responsibilities:       Operating room setup: Prepare the operating room before surgeries, ensuring it is clean, sterile, and properly equipped with the necessary instruments, supplies, and equipment     Surgical instrument sterilization: Sterilize and arrange surgical instruments and equipment, ensuring compliance with infection control protocols and maintaining instrument inventory     Patient preparation: Assist in positioning and preparing patients for surgery, ensuring their safety and comfort during the procedure     Surgical team support: Provide support to the surgical team by handing instruments and supplies to the surgeons and nurses during surgeries     Equipment operation: Set up and operate surgical equipment, such as lights, suction devices, monitors, and anesthesia machines, ensuring their proper functioning throughout the surgery
column11: Operation theatre

column2: Holy Family Hospital is looking for OT / Anesthesia Technician to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Equipment Setup: Prepare and set up anesthesia machines, monitors, and related equipment in the operating room or other procedural areas      Monitoring and Testing: Ensure that all anesthesia equipment is functioning correctly and perform routine testing and calibration as needed      Patient Preparation: Assist in preparing patients for anesthesia administration, which may include positioning, securing monitoring devices, and placing intravenous (IV) lines      Medication Preparation: Help in preparing anesthesia medications and solutions for administration by the anesthesia provider      Emergency Response: Be prepared to assist in emergencies or critical situations during anesthesia administration
